descriptor.value: When the system Initializes, the Boiler must send a Waiting event.
When the system Initializes, the Boiler's state variable, Mode, must be Init.
When the system Initializes, the valve should not be open.
When the system Initializes, the Boiler must not send a Ready event.
If OpMode is Init and Valve has an event, then Open the Valve (OpenValve == True)
If OpMode is Init and has received the ProgramReady event, then Boiler should send the Ready message.
If OpMode is not Init or Boiler has not received the Valve event, then the Valve remains unchanged.
If OpMode is not Init or Boiler has not received the ProgramReady event, then Boiler will not send the Ready message.
The Waiting message must never be sent (This is because it is sent when the component is initialized, and only once, so it should not be done here).
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local isPumpOpen value must be false.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local isPumpFlow value must be false.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local pumpNumber is set between 0 and 3.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's output port ready should not send a message.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's output port pumpOpen should send a message containing false.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's output port pumpFlow should send a message containing false.
If programReady has an event, then a ready event must be sent.
If programReady does not have an event, then a ready event can not be sent.
If openPump has an event, then the pump is opened or closed according to the event.
If openPump does not have an event, then the pump remains in its previous state.
Always send a pumpOpen event, it should contain whether or not the pump is open (isPumpOpen).
Always send a pumpFlow event, it should contain whether or not the pump has water flowing (isPumpFlow).
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local isPumpOpen value must be false.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local isPumpFlow value must be false.
When the system Initializes, the Pump's local pumpNumber is set between 0 and 3.

When the system Initializes, the Pump's output port pumpOpen should send a message containing false.

level message is sent with volume as its value.
ready message is not sent during initialization.
If programReady has an event, then a ready event must be sent if the component is ready.
If programReady does not have an event, then a ready event can not be sent.
Each computational cycle, the Water Level Reader will send the water level equal to its volume variable reading.
level message is sent with volume as its value.
ready message is not sent during initialization.

computedRate, the local variable for the Steam Meter is the volume of steam recorded from the reader divided by 5 (each compute cycle in the system is 5 seconds apart). Note, the amount of steam recorded from a lower level hardware is presumed in this system implementation to provide the volume read between each of its cycles. This was also done so that way there is a computational element to the reading for logika and other testers to have to deal with division. It is likely in other implementations that it would be returning the rate, and thus, the rate would be supplied to the port directly.
If programReady has an event, then a ready event must be sent if the component is ready.
If programReady does not have an event, then a ready event can not be sent.
Each computational cycle, the Steam Meter will send the computedRate through a rate message.

computedRate, the local variable for the Steam Meter is the volume of steam recorded from the reader divided by 5 (each compute cycle in the system is 5 seconds apart). Note, the amount of steam recorded from a lower level hardware is presumed in this system implementation to provide the volume read between each of its cycles. This was also done so that way there is a computational element to the reading for logika and other testers to have to deal with division. It is likely in other implementations that it would be returning the rate, and thus, the rate would be supplied to the port directly.
All 'is part broken' state variable booleans start equal to false.
All repair messages are not send during initialization.
All failure acknowledgement messages are not send during initialization.
Stop message is not sent during Initialization.
If there is not already a failure on Pump 0 and there is a nonempty port saying Pump 0 has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
If there is not already a failure on Pump 1 and there is a nonempty port saying Pump 1 has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
If there is not already a failure on Pump 2 and there is a nonempty port saying Pump 2 has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
If there is not already a failure on Pump 3 and there is a nonempty port saying Pump 3 has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
For Pump 0, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Pump 1, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Pump 2, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Pump 3, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Pump 0, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
For Pump 1, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
For Pump 2, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
For Pump 3, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
If there is not already a failure on the Water Level and there is a nonempty port saying the Water Level has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
If there is not already a failure on the Steam Meter and there is a nonempty port saying the Steam Meter has failed, then OpDesk will acknowledge the failure.
For Water Level, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Steam Meter, if OpDesk has already acknowledged a given failure, or there is no failure present from the event ports, then there will be no failure acknowledgement sent for the component.
For Water Level, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
For Water Level, if there the system is aware of a failure, then the operator may say it has been repaired. If they do, then send a repair message for the relavent component.
